discussion_comments.comment_body: why does your PR modify circle ci?

why version of Python do you want to use? 3.9 or 3.12? 
You're using 3.12 in GitHub & 3.9 elsewhere - makes it hard to figure out how to fix the broken unit tests

discussion_comments.comment_body: please can we see the sha source for all these. I'd like to validate the shas are valid

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ jobs:
   auto_update_price_and_context_window:
     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     steps:
-      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+      - uses: actions/checkout@f43a0e5ff2bd294095638e18286ca9a3d1956744  # v3
discussion_comments.comment_body:
Absolutely, I understand the need to verify ;)

I'm not sure I understand what you mean with the SHA source though?

If you browse to the repository of the used action, and find the tag the action is referencing, you'll be able to see commit SHA the tag is pointing to.

For example, checkout@v3 resolves to the latest v3 version, which is v3.6.0. That version can be found here: https://github.com/actions/checkout/commit/f43a0e5ff2bd294095638e18286ca9a3d1956744 - Notice how the commit hash for that version is identical to the hash specified in the PR.

If you're interested in the source code that generated these changes, have a look at https://codeberg.org/madsrc/gh-action-pin
